result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Lynn Huff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with good time and huber release

miscConds.notes: Payment of restitution = $715.00 (including surcharge), joint and several with co-deft.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $589.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with co-deft.
No contact with victim.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
No contact with any of the Officers involved in the incident, except in their official capacity.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must participate in some type of 12-step program.
Provide complete and truthful testimony against co-deft and cooperate with law enforcement.
May not go to Michigan or any other state where THC is legal for any reason, except for treatment purposes and only with prior agent approval.

records.addlTxt:
9:48 AM Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Samantha Lynn Huff.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 3.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Spansail satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Counts 1 and 3.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Spansail heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1:
9 months jail with good time and huber release and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Conditions of probation:
Payment of restitution = $715.00 (including surcharge), joint and several with co-deft.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $589.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No contact with co-deft.
No contact with victim.
No contact with known drug users or sellers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
No contact with any of the officers involved in the incident, unless in their official capacity.
AODA and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must participate in some type of 12-step program.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Provide complete and truthful testimony against co-deft and cooperate with law enforcement.
May not go to MI or any other state where THC is legal, for any reason, except for treatment purposes and only with prior agent approval.
DNA sample due 06-22-2022.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 3:
9 months jail, consecutive to Count 1 with good time and huber release and places Deft on probation for 2 years concurrent to Count 1.
Conditions of probation:
90 days conditional jail, without good time.
Credit for 85 days time served.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $579.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No contact with co-deft.
No contact with victim.
No contact with known drug users or sellers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
No contact with any of the officers involved in the incident, unless in their official capacity.
AODA and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must participate in some type of 12-step program.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Provide complete and truthful testimony against co-deft and cooperate with law enforcement.
May not go to MI or any other state where THC is legal, for any reason, except for treatment purposes and only with prior agent approval.
DNA sample due 06-22-2022.
Appeal rights.

Plea hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Restitution and VIS from Loaves & Fishes

3:09 PM Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen appeared by video for Samantha Lynn Huff.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA heard on amendment of dates on the complaint.
Copy of info
Waives reading
Pleads n/g
Requests STC 
3:14PM
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:50 pm.

3:15 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Samantha Lynn Huff. 
Prelim quest/WOR provided - Atty Spansail satisfied.
Def waives prelim
Court finds def freely waives prelim
Def bound over for trial.
Atty Hansen out at jail will cover for Atty Spansail at next hearing.
3:19 pm
Arraignment scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:44 AM Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samantha Lynn Huff appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
Requests prelim within time limits.
Court schedules.
8:46 AM
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:38 AM Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Defendant Samantha Lynn Huff in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samantha Lynn Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - deft understands charges and penalties.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with victim, E.S.W. or co-deft M.C. 
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
Court schedules with parties.
11:41 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
